SEARCH

Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date extends Object
The Date class defines a date, month, year, and the time. It is to be used to store the date of a reservation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Date(int day)
    This constructor creates a Date instance with just a given day, setting the month and year to June 2024.

      Returns:
      Day of the month.

      Gets the Date object's month number.
      Returns:
      Month of the year.

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Gets the Date object's year number.
      Returns:
      Year number.

    • getHour

      public int getHour()
      Gets the Date object's hour number.
      Returns:
      Hour of the day from 0-23.

    • getMinute

      public int getMinute()
      Gets the Date object's minute number.
      Returns:
      Minute of the hour from 0-59.

    • getTime

      public String getTime()
      Gets the time of the Date object expressed as a String.
      Returns:
      Formatted String regarding the time.

    • getFormattedDate

      public String getFormattedDate()
      getFormattedDate() returns a string containing the date, formatted in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM
      Returns:
      Formatted String regarding the full date.

    • setHour

      public void setHour(int hour)
      Sets the hour variable in the Date object.
      Parameters:
      hour - Hour number that the hour variable will be set to.

    • setMinute

      public void setMinute(int minute)
      Sets the minute variable in the Date object.
      Parameters:
      minute - Minute number that the minute variable will be set to.

    • getDayDifference

      public int getDayDifference(Date otherDate)
      getDayDifference() returns the difference between the date object and another given as a parameter in days.
      Parameters:
      otherDate - Other date object to get difference of. (otherDate - this date object).
      Returns:
      Difference in days between two dates.

    • isBefore

      public boolean isBefore(Date date)
      Checks if this Date object's date is before a given Date object's date.
      Parameters:
      date - Other Date object to compare.
      Returns:
      true if this Date object is before the given Date object parameter. False otherwise.

    • isAfter

      public boolean isAfter(Date date)
      Checks if this Date object's date is after a given Date object's date.
      Parameters:
      date - Other Date object to compare.
      Returns:
      true if this Date object is after the given Date object parameter. False otherwise.

    • isBetween

      public boolean isBetween(Date dateAfter, Date dateBefore)
      isBetween() checks if this Date is in between two other Date instances.
      Parameters:
      dateAfter - The Date after this Date.
      dateBefore - The Date before this Date.
      Returns:
      True if the Date object is before the 2nd date parameter and after the 1st date parameter.
